snippet: Kenya is about to hold another major election on Monday, the first since the tumult of 2007 and 2008, but the Rift Valley is still polarized.
abstract: Kenya is about to hold another major election, first since tumult of 2007 and 2008, but the Rift Valley, which endured ferocious ethnic violence at the time, is still polarized; some of the ethnic prejudices and poisonous feelings have shifted along with changes in political alliances, but many are still wary of repeat of violence.

byline.contributor: Somini Sengupta contributed reporting from San Francisco.

lead_paragraph: Kenya is about to hold another major election on Monday, the first since the tumult of 2007 and 2008, but the Rift Valley is still polarized.

headline.main: On Eve of Vote, Fragile Valley in Kenya Faces New Divisions
headline.print_headline: On Eve of Vote, Fragile Valley In Kenya Faces New Divisions
